content: Colin M. Gray, PhD â€“ Associate Professor, Indiana University Bloomington Mastodon I am a scholar in human-computer interaction, design, & education. Find out more about my research I engage in transdisciplinary research and education across multiple contexts I seek to describe the experiences of designers, investigating how they develop and apply design knowledge in socially-responsible ways. Human-Computer Interaction I study: dark patterns; ethics and values; UX competence; practice-led research; translational science and the research-practice gap. Learning & Instructional Design I study: aesthetic learning experiences; student agency; critical ethnographic approaches; instructional design for higher education Design Theory and Education I study: design methods; design knowledge(s); design character; design identity; design judgment; ethics and values; design competence Chat with me Email me at: comgray@iu.edu
